title: How powerful was the Eastern Roman Empire? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was powerful enough to resist Muslim invasion for centuries, and to launch attempts to re-control the Western Empire; “power” is relative, and it became hemmed in by city-states of Italy on the west and Muslim powers on the East, although it continued to be wealthy.

They did alright for themselves. If you have time for podcasts, check out The History of Byzantium. He covers the history of the Eastern Empire from the fall of the west in 476 AD, to the fall of Constantinople in 1463. I've only made it to about the year 700, but they're definitely holding their own. Bear in mind also, that the Eastern Empire existed before the fall of the Western Empire. Diocletian split the empire into two halves in 285.
